intro: Acer robustum var. honanense, commonly known as the Honan maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a rounded crown. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens and parks.
